text:
Chambers and Hudson Streets, West Side, at point of intersection, with Broadway looking Southwards.

W

1860

Irving Underhill, Photographer,
New York City.

(1) At the convergence of Hudson Street (left) and West Broadway (right), looking northward from Reade Street. The 6-story building at the apex bears Nos. 114-116 Reade Street, 24 Hudson Street and 110-116 West Broadway. Also shown is the Sixth Ave. Elevated Line on the latter Street. July 2, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, at a later date, showing the Western Union Building on Thomas Street, between Hudson Street and West Broadway (former site of the R.C. Williams warehouses). February 11, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.

(3) The same, Hudson Street and West Broadway at point of intersection. May 4, 1941.
P.L. Sperr,
